labels.name: duplicate
labels.description: This issue or pull request already exists

labels.name: wontfix
labels.description: This will not be worked on

issues.title: Scope of the draft
issues.author: sergiobelotti
issues.body: Action @all: Use existing FGNM YANG I-D to capture common definitions, and then split for technology specific elements in future I-Ds.

comments.author: sergiobelotti
comments.body: We are meeting again in 2 weeks . For that time : review the present version of the draft and provide comments/request for clarifications.

issues.title: FGNM acronym replacement
issues.author: sergiobelotti
issues.body:
We are not happy with the "FGNM" naming since it has been confused with "Fine-grain optical transport networking (fgOTN)"
Action @AdrianFarrel : to provide some suggestions for an FGNM acronym replacement

comments.author: sergiobelotti
comments.body: The new agreed name is "RDNM". We need to update the name of github repository, the name of the draft and text in the draft, and the name of invitation call.

comments.author: danielkinguk
comments.body: Updated the acronym to FDNM in draft-ietf-ccamp-actn-optical-transport-mgmt (02 ver).

issues.title: Review and comment on the 01 of the draft-yu-ccamp-te-fgnm-yang-01
issues.author: sergiobelotti
issues.body:
I've summarized some comments in the attached word document
[draft-yu-ccamp-te-fgnm-yang-01.docx](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18113276/draft-yu-ccamp-te-fgnm-yang-01.docx)

issues.title: Clarify the text on replacing FCAPS
issues.author: danielkinguk
issues.body:
Observation from Scott that we are not replacing FCAPS, but we are providing FCAPS capability for ACTN.

For example, see:

  "This enhanced ACTN architecture is known as ACTN Rich-Detail Network
   Management (ACTN RDNM).  It provides an evolution path for FCAPS
   Operational Support System (OSS) functions from Common Object Request
   Broker Architecture (CORBA) [CORBA] interfaces and the Multi-
   Technology Operations System Interface (MTOSI) architecture [MTOSI],
   to IETF YANG-based models and RESTful APIs."

We need to update to ensure that we are not replacing, but providing some FCAPS capability.

comments.author: italobusi
comments.body: Text added in [draft-ietf-ccamp-actn-optical-transport-mgmt-02](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/draft-ietf-ccamp-actn-optical-transport-mgmt-02)

issues.title: Agree Use Case for FDNM that we can document in detail
issues.author: danielkinguk
issues.body: Use case to be agreed, this could be in the existing YANG document or an applicability statement.

issues.title: Clarification of TTP model and terminology
issues.author: YuChaode
issues.body:
Tunnel termination point (TTP) in IETF TE topology context represents a pool of potential trail termination points(TTP) for connections/LSPs. 
See Sergio's comments in #4 on section 4: [draft-yu-ccamp-te-fgnm-yang-01.docx](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18113276/draft-yu-ccamp-te-fgnm-yang-01.docx).
Some clarification is needed  in the document.

issues.title: Seperate the scenarios of tunnel segment and E2E tunnel
issues.author: YuChaode
issues.body: The tunnel's endpoint contains two scenarios right now, the tunnel can start from a LTP which maybe a scenario of tunnel segment. It needs some more discussion.

issues.title: The discussion of terminology maping of different modelling
issues.author: YuChaode
issues.body:
It is important to align the terminology of different modelling, so that the FCAPS functionalities can be inherit by our RDNM work. And we can eliminate the difficulty of integrating different interfaces.

[Mapping.pptx](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/19159253/Mapping.pptx)

comments.author: nigel-r-davis
comments.body:
As presennted on the call 20250403.

[Mappings-IETF.pptx](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/19618642/Mappings-IETF.pptx)

The slide shows various industry models side by side relating all to ITU-G.805. It highlights some questions regarding the roles of the entities in the IETF models.

issues.title: Text rephrase
issues.author: YuChaode
issues.body:
"Traditional transport standards do not include a concept of TE-related modeling. If we aim to extend the current IETF data models for a comprehensive representation of the traditional approach, referred to as the RDNM extension. We propose defining common attributes for all technologies within a TE topology RDNM extension model."

_Originally posted by @danielkinguk in https://github.com/YuChaode/rdnm-yang/pull/8#discussion_r1963607226_

pulls.title: Remove TE and Replace FGNM with RDNM
pulls.author: YuChaode

comments.body:
Do we need to prefix RDNM with TE?

```suggestion
       |     TE topology      |<----------|      RDNM Extension  |
```

Do we need to prefix RDNM with TE?

```suggestion
   |      TE Tunnel       |<----------|      RDNM Extension  |
```

Do we need to emphasize TE everywhere? Do we need ext suffix?
The prefixes also looks too long. The conventions we are using are otnt for topology and otn-tnl for tunnel.

What about:

```suggestion
|  rdnmt | ietf-rdnm-topology | RFC XXXX      |
| rdnm-tnl | ietf-rdnm-tunnel            | RFC XXXX      |
| rdnm-types | ietf-rdnm-types | RFC XXXX      |
```

typo

```suggestion
## RDNM Extension for TE Topology
```

typo:

```suggestion
## RDNM Extension for TE Tunnel
```

I do not think we need to specify extensions for the types but just new RDNM types:

```suggestion
## RDNM Types

~~~~ yang
```

See previous comment:

```suggestion
{: #fig-te-types-rdnm-yang title="RDNM Types YANG module"
```
"...in a TE topology RDNM extension model." , Shall we need to add "TE" up front to topology word ?
delete te both for the tree fig and for the model
I think it would be without "te"
it seems to me the suggestion above by Italo was to avoid "te" : ietf-rdnm-types

reviews.author: danielkinguk
reviews.body: A few minor changes to wording.

comments.body: I think we can say "RDNM is designed to deliver traditional FCAPS capabilities.", designed probably better word than aimed.

"Some extensions, which are generic for all network layers, will be defined in the RDNM extension models, including the generic TE topology RDNM extension and the generic TE tunnel RDNM extension. Layer-specific RDNM extensions can be found in other YANG data modules."

"Traditional transport standards do not include a concept of TE-related modeling. If we aim to extend the current IETF data models for a comprehensive representation of the traditional approach, referred to as the RDNM extension. We propose defining common attributes for all technologies within a TE topology RDNM extension model."
RDNM is designed to continue to deliver FCAPS capabilities within the context of ACTN.
Some extensions, which are generic for all network layers, are defined in the RDNM topology and RDNM tunnel models. Layer-specific RDNM extensions can be found in other YANG data modules.
To do: to chage the YANG models' name and the prefix.
To do: Daniel will update the sentences after the meeting.
Will do after the meeting.
Will do after the meeting
Replace tabs with space
agree

```suggestion
But in the traditional transport standards there is not such a saying of  TE-related modelling. If we want to extend the current IETF data models to have full modelling of traditional approach, which is called RDNM extension by us, we suggest to define the common attributes for all the technologies in a RDNM extension model.
```
See #12
